//notes: SureFire SOCOM devices are not compatible with earlier SureFire Fast Attach devices
description: A muzzle brake that provides average improvement to the handling of the gun.  Used to be popular with Special Forces before the Cataclysm.  Can be used to mount the SOCOM suppressor.  <muzzle/brake>

variants.description: An unassuming muzzle brake with average, though still significant, performance.  It can serve as a mount for the SOCOM556-RC2 suppressor.  <muzzle/brake>  <variant:black>

notes: assumes that the dips and bumps even out
diameter is assumed based on similar muzzle brakes

//integral_longest_side: assumes mounting onto a standard length of thread for 1/2×28-threaded barrel (16 mm)
//handling_modifier: we use the values of its brother, SureFire Procomp, as the closest approximation
//price: presumed to be the price for the smaller caliber (.223 / 5.56mm)

//notes: this is currently using the 1/2-28× threading, which is for 5.56mm NATO or lower only
something like .308 would require a different thread
description: This unassuming but capable muzzle brake is able to recoil by a value well above average.  Can be used to mount the Dominus suppressor.  <muzzle/rating:556>  <muzzle/brake>

variants.description: An unassuming but highly-capable muzzle brake, the SR is capable of reducing recoil by more than 70%.  It can also serve as a mount for an equally-capable Dominus-SR suppressor, also from Thunder Beast.  <muzzle/rating:556>  <muzzle/brake>  <variant:black/matte>

//weight: the PEW Science review states the weight of the 5.56mm NATO model to be 5.2 oz = 147.42 g

notes: diameter is assumed to be diameter of Dominus SR suppressor, minus 35%

//integral_longest_side: assumes mounting onto a standard length of thread for 1/2 in. × 28-threaded barrel (16 mm)
//handling_modifier: its 5.56mm cousin reduces recoil by 72.93%, so let's assume this one performs only slightly worse, at a completely-fictional 70.62%
